Hi Aaron,

You are right! We are in the middle of refactoring our
code to use the GuiTask (now renamed to GuiQuery)
(issue 187 -
http://code.google.com/p/fest/issues/detail?id=187 ).
FEST's next release (1.0b2) will have this fix in
place.

Many thanks for your feedback! :)

-Alex

--- hybrid180 <aaron@...> wrote:

> 
> Hi Alex,
> 
> Thank you for your suggestions, I looked into the
> FEST framework and I
> actually have started to use it.  However, when I
> tried to use it I would
> still get the same problem that I started this
> thread with.
> 
> From what I can tell by looking at the FEST source
> is that FEST still
> queries the table from whichever thread it is being
> called from.  This again
> brings me back to my problem: How do I query the
> table that gets modified on
> the EDT thread from a junit thread.
> 
> I ultimately ended up using
> SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait using a final int
> array that stores the number of rows in the table. 
> I then use an assert
> after the invoteAndWait on this final int array to
> make sure the number of
> rows is correct.
> 
> One other thing, so happens when I finally got
> around to your suggestion and
> looked at FEST, you had taken out the GuiTask class!
>  I finally figured it
> out and noticed too that you are adding a whole lot
> of queries that get run
> in the EDT thread.  So far I really like what I see
> with FEST and will
> continue to use it.
> 
> Thanks for the suggestions and keep up the good
> work!
> Aaron
> 
> 
> Alex Ruiz wrote:
> > 
> > Hi Aaron,
> > 
> > My suggestion is either:
> > 
> > 1. Use FEST ( http://fest.easytesting.org/swing )
> to
> > test your GUIs. FEST is a library provides a
> compact,
> > intuitive and easy-to-use API that makes GUI
> testing
> > easy (disclaimer: I'm the creator of FEST.)
> > 
> > 2. If you decide not to use FEST, you can still
> use
> > FEST's GuiTask to solve your problem. Since FEST
> is
> > open source and under the Apache 2.0 license, you
> can
> > copy the source of GuiTask. Please note that
> GuiTask
> > uses invokeAndWait instead of invokeLater. IMHO,
> most
> > of the time in your test you need to wait for an
> > action to be executed in the EDT before you can
> > continue the execution of your test. You can find
> the
> > code for GuiTask at
> >
>
http://code.google.com/p/fest/source/browse/trunk/fest/fest-swing/src/main/java/org/fest/swing/core/GuiTask.java
> > 
> > Cheers,
> > -Alex
> > 
> >

> test
> >> not pass when this
> >> assert fails?  Or at least throw the
> AssertionError
> >> on the Junit thread
> >> instead of the Swing thread?
> >>
